text:
```
Decorated For Vietnam Service

Col Walt Numie, USMC, con-
gratulates Cpl. Mike Fitzpatrick
right, after presenting him with
the Navy Achievement Medal.
The inscription on the photo
reads "To Cpl. Fitz." To one of
the Marines who really do the
lighting and make the "corp's
what it is I am proud of you
Walt Numie, Col, USMC, 1-24-69

The certificate accompanying
the medal reads as follows:

Citation
-While serving as a Squad
leader with Company 'C' First
Battalion, Third Marines, Third
Marine Division in connection
with operations against the en-
emy in the Republic of Vietnam
from 23 September 1967 to 21
September 1968 Corporal Fitz-
patrick performed his duties in
an exemplary manner. Partic-
ipating in sixteen major combat
operations including Operations
Kentucky, V. Jeb Stuart and
Lancaster he demonstrated his
out-standing leadership and combat
readiness of his unit,Corporal Fitzpatrick's leadership,professionalcompetence and steadfast devo-
tion to duty reflect great credit
upon himself, the Marine Corps
and the Naval Service.

Corporal Fitzpatrick is auth-
orized to wear the CombatRibbon.

For the Secretary of the Navy,
H W Buse, Jr
Lieutenant General, U S Marine
Corps
Commanding General, Fleet
Marine Force Pacific

Cpl Fitzpatrick is the son of
Mr and Mrs Neil Fitzpatrick of
Merrimack, N H and the first
of their four children to serve
in the military service. He
following his enlistment enteredthe Marine Corps 2 April 1966.
```
